rows.title: Meditation

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes.
Let's use the magic power of 3 to stay present and relax. 

Name 3 sounds you can hear right now.
Name 3 smells you can smell right now.
Name your 3 favourite foods.
What are 3 things you can be gratefful for right now.

At the end of a touch day, thinking of 3 things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.

rows.transcript:
Close your eyes.
Let's use the magic power of 3 to stay present and relax. 

Name 3 sounds you can hear right now.
Name 3 smells you can smell right now.
Name your 3 favourite foods.
What are 3 things you can be gratefful for right now.

At the end of a touch day, thinking of 3 things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.

text_1.eng: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about helping your child learn and grow. 

Playing with your child is important for their growth and learning, both in and out of school. This is true for all children, including those with disabilities.

Did you know that playing helps your child learn what is expected and how to get along with others?

Children learn a lot by asking questions. Support their interests and curiosity, and be patient when they make mistakes. We all learn from our mistakes!

media_title.eng: How will it help me and my family?

media_transcript.eng:
Hello!
Do you know that children learn best through playing? 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.

rows.media_transcript:
Hello!
Do you know that children learn best through playing? 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Children learn best by playing and doing. 

@data.characters.f3_mother.name wants to spend more time helping her son, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, learn through play together. Let’s see how she does it.

character_1_text.eng: Hi, my love. Would you like to do something fun together?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Children learn best by playing and doing. 

@data.characters.f3_mother.name wants to spend more time helping her son, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, learn through play together. Let’s see how she does it.
rows.character_1_text: Hi, my love. Would you like to do something fun together?

character_1_text.eng: What would you like to do?

character_2_text.eng: Build a house out of bed sheets!

character_3_text.eng: Great idea! What do we need to do first?

rows.character_1_text: What would you like to do?
rows.character_2_text: Build a house out of bed sheets!
rows.character_3_text: Great idea! What do we need to do first?

character_1_text.eng: First, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It’s our first wall! Then, we can use a pillow at the bottom.

character_2_text.eng: It's lovely to see you thinking everything through so carefully.

rows.character_1_text: First, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It’s our first wall! Then, we can use a pillow at the bottom.
rows.character_2_text: It's lovely to see you thinking everything through so carefully.

character_1_text.eng:
Well done,
@data.characters.f3_son_4.name! This is a wonderful bedsheet house.

character_2_text.eng: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

rows.character_1_text:
Well done,
@data.characters.f3_son_4.name! This is a wonderful bedsheet house.
rows.character_2_text: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f3_mother.name helped her son learn by playing together. Let’s explore how she did this.

quiz_1_question.eng: What did @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learn when his mother played with him?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: How to lead and give instructions

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, by self-directing, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learned how to give clear instructions and lead an activity. This is an important skill for any successful adult!

There are other correct answers in this list. Did you find them all?

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
That’s right! By creatively imagining what a home could be, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name finds an innovative way to repurpose a bed sheet. In his imagination, he could be building a castle, bear den, or space shuttle. Innovation and creativity are critical skills for the future. 

This isn’t the only thing @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learned! Did you find the other things he learned?

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: How to imagine new possibilities & problem solve

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
That’s it! By imagining a world with a tent that doesn’t yet exist, and creatively solving a challenge, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name is learning critical skills for academic and professional success. 
There are more right answers in this list. Did you find them?

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng:
That’s right! By testing and trying materials to build a fort, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name is learning critical STEM skills and the parts of 3-dimensional shapes. 

There is more than one answer in this list! Did you find them all?

quiz_2_question.eng: How did @data.characters.f3_mother.name help her son learn these skills?  There are lots of right answers to this one!

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! Their play time together had so many opportunities to learn new skills.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Actually, by simply playing with her son and letting him lead the activity, @data.characters.f3_mother.name helps her son learn. She doesn’t have to show him how to build a fort, he learns on his own with natural consequences.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f3_mother.name lets her son lead, she allows him to explore the laws of gravity (will the sheet fall?), 3-dimensional shapes, and build communication skills.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: That’s right. When @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises her son, he learns that it is good to be curious, inventive, and attentive to detail. He is more likely to repeat these behaviours in the future because he has been praised for them.

There are other correct answers in this list. Did you find them all?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Children (just like us) can learn a lot from their mistakes.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to learn from her mistake when she plays a bit too rough indoors.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, please walk slowly in the house! You’re going to break something

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Children (just like us) can learn a lot from their mistakes.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to learn from her mistake when she plays a bit too rough indoors.
rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, please walk slowly in the house! You’re going to break something

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name runs into a table and breaks a vase. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name sees and is concerned.

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name runs into a table and breaks a vase. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name sees and is concerned.

character_2_text.eng: No, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.

rows.character_2_text: No, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.

character_1_text.eng: I am not happy that you broke the vase but appreciate you for realising your mistake and apologising. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?

character_2_text.eng: Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you asked me to walk in the house.

rows.character_1_text: I am not happy that you broke the vase but appreciate you for realising your mistake and apologising. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?
rows.character_2_text: Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you asked me to walk in the house.

character_1_text.eng: It’s OK, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.

rows.character_1_text: It’s OK, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name helped @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learn from her mistake!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: He gives an instruction to prevent the mistake

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, he warns her in order to avoid the mistake.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, when your child makes a mistake it is important to stay calm.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: He shows he cares most about @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, when the accident happens, he first asks if @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name is okay!

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: He thanks @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name for recognising her mistake

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Yes, praise helps our children to take more responsibility for their actions next time.

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: He asks @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to reflect on her behaviour

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Yes, he helps her learn by asking her how she could have prevented the mistake.

quiz_1_option_6_text.eng: He involves @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to resolve the situation together

quiz_1_feedback_6.eng: Yes, by asking her to help clean up, he shows how she can make things right again after making a mistake.

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: It is okay to make mistakes

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: I am still loved even if I make mistakes

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: I can learn from my mistakes

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: I can help to make things right again

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

section_1_text.eng:
Play is the main way children learn and develop. Through play, they build important physical and social skills. 

Set aside time to play games with your child, be creative, and have fun together.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Through play, you also learn what kind of support your child may need.

Support your child to play and make friends with other children, so they learn how to interact with others well. 

If your child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause and playing together.

section_2_text.eng:
Learning new things takes time. Be patient and encourage your child to keep trying things they may find hard. 

Stay calm when they get angry or frustrated - your child will learn to do the same over time.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
You can support them by praising them for trying and helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks appropriate for their age.

Use play to help your child learn difficult skills, like losing, sharing, or taking turns.

section_3_text.eng:
Children learn by asking questions and exploring the things they are interested in. Give your child time and space to do this. 

Join your child’s activities and ask them questions to encourage them to learn more.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Your child may talk a lot and have many questions - including difficult ones. You can give your child short but honest answers. 

If you need a break or more information, you can take a pause and tell your child you will respond to them later.

Set aside time to play games with your child, be creative, and have fun together.
rows.section_1_extra_text:

Support your child to play and make friends with other children, so they learn how to interact with others well. 

If your child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause and playing together.

Stay calm when they get angry or frustrated - your child will learn to do the same over time.
rows.section_2_extra_text:
You can support them by praising them for trying and helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks appropriate for their age.

Use play to help your child learn difficult skills, like losing, sharing, or taking turns.
rows.section_3_text:

Join your child’s activities and ask them questions to encourage them to learn more.
rows.section_3_extra_text:
Your child may talk a lot and have many questions - including difficult ones. You can give your child short but honest answers. 

If you need a break or more information, you can take a pause and tell your child you will respond to them later.

media_title.eng: How it helped a parent like you:

media_transcript.eng:
I thought that my daughter only started learning when she went to school. 

@global.app_name gave me lots of ideas for what I could do to help her develop at home. By playing together, we were able to practise many words in a fun way. She is speaking much more now, and we are closer because of the time we spend together.

rows.media_title: How it helped a parent like you:
rows.media_transcript:
I thought that my daughter only started learning when she went to school. 

@global.app_name gave me lots of ideas for what I could do to help her develop at home. By playing together, we were able to practise many words in a fun way. She is speaking much more now, and we are closer because of the time we spend together.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Want to help your child develop and grow?

Invite your child to play with you today. Encourage them to ask questions and explore new things through play.

quiz_1_question.eng: What could you do today to encourage your child to play and learn?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That’s right! Join in on any play activity your child is doing. You will strengthen your bond and encourage your child to play and learn more.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Great idea. Try to look for opportunities to play and learn, like balancing over a ridge or collecting leaves or rocks along the way.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes! Get creative. Anything in your home could be a music instrument, costume, or item in a role-play.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Exactly. If you are not sure how you could play together, your child will have many ideas for what you could do.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Great idea. Try to look for opportunities to play and learn, like balancing over a ridge or collecting leaves or rocks along the way.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes! Get creative. Anything in your home could be a music instrument, costume, or item in a role-play.
rows.quiz_1_question: What could you do today to encourage your child to play and learn?

Want to help your child develop and grow?

Invite your child to play with you today. Encourage them to ask questions and explore new things through play.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Exactly. If you are not sure how you could play together, your child will have many ideas for what you could do.
